description: From Middle English uncoroun, uncroun, uncrowne; equivalent to un- +‎ crown.

verbs.description: uncrown (third-person singular simple present uncrowns, present participle uncrowning, simple past and past participle uncrowned)

entries.meaning: To deprive of the monarchy or other authority or status.
examples: Synonyms: decrown, depose, dethrone, discrown, disenthrone, unking, unthrone

entries.meaning: To remove a crown from (often figuratively).
examples: When rigid Cold in Ice hath all things bound,
And Forrests of their Summers pride uncrown’d.
